questions.text: Location of WHO headquarters of the Southeast Asian Region is located in:

World Health Assembly

World Health Assembly: Health parliament & supreme governing body of organization.

questions.text: Time bound statement of purpose is:

COV

COEEFICIENT OF VARIATION (COV): Unit free measure to compare 2 dissimilar variables.

questions.text: Prevalence ± 1 SD pertains to:

Maximum behaviour change is seen in:
“GATHER” approach is an example of:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Counselling
Explanation
The GATHER approach is a structured framework used in family planning counselling to guide discussions about contraception. It involves six steps: Greet, Ask, Tell, Help, Explain, and Return.

questions.text: Right man in right job is labelled as:

 Silicosis
Explanation
Silicosis is a more specific answer than pneumoconiosis.

questions.text: Maximum fatality occurs due to which form of disaster?

Hydrological

Maximum fatality: hydrological disasters

A

All of these

questions.text: CET includes all of following except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

AQI
Explanation
Corrected Effective Temperature (CET)
• T - Temperature
• M - Mean radiant heat; movement of air/ air velocity
• H - Humidity

questions.text: Norms for air change in living room per hour is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

2-3 
Explanation
Ventilation
• Space: fresh air supply of 3000 ft3/hour/ person
• Air change: 2- 3 changes/ hour in living room & 4- 6 times in workplace

questions.text: Protective for global warming is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

 Ozone
Explanation
Global warming/ GHG
• Water vapour (highest)
• CO2 (2nd highest): measured by kiffer’s test
• Ozone (protective & CFCs deplete it)

questions.text: Most dangerous particle pertaining for air pollution is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

PM 2.5
Explanation
Most dangerous particle: PM 2.5 uM 
WHO annual PM 2.5 guideline: 5ug/ m3

questions.text: How frequently do we have to apply kerosene oil in the drains?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

7 days
Explanation
Life Cycle of Mosquito:
• Males: short lived
• Females: Overall life span: 8 to 34 days
– Larval stage: 5 to 7 days (anti larval has to be used every 7 days)
– Egg stage: 1- 2 days
– Transformation to Adult stage: 7- 10 days
– Adult: 2 weeks

choices.text: Last child leaves home of parents

questions.solution:

Last child leaves home of parents

Explanation

questions.text: Total number of girl child a female has is:
Replacement level of fertility, TFR:
To achieve NRR = 1; CPR:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

> 60%
Explanation
To achieve stable population NRR = 1; which is obtained when CPR > 60%.

questions.text: Multiplication factor for PEARL Index is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)
1200
Explanation
Definition: Number of unplanned pregnancies that occur during a specified period of exposure and use of contraceptive method.

PEARL Index is used to measure.

PI = Total Accidental Pregnancies * 1200
Total Months of Exposure

Total Months of Exposure: No. of females followed * No. of months 
Unit: Hundred Women years (HWY)

questions.text: Lowest level of health system where “Eligible couple” register is maintained is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Subcentre
Explanation
• EC register maintained a at sub centre
• EC: A currently married couple with wife in reproductive age group (15 – 49 years: NEET)
• 150 – 180 ECs per 1000 population in India

questions.text: World TB Day theme 2025 is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Commit, Invest, Deliver
Explanation
The theme for World Tuberculosis (TB) Day 2025 is "Yes! We Can End TB: Commit, Invest, Deliver". This theme emphasizes the urgent need for global commitment, increased investment, and decisive action to eliminate tuberculosis as a public health threat. It highlights the importance of collective efforts from governments, healthcare systems, and communities to achieve a TB-free future.

questions.text: Target towards Elimination of Cervical Cancer WHO Initiative; year is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 2030
Explanation
Target towards Elimination of Cervical Cancer by 2030
• WHO annual incidence rate: ≤ 4 cases/ 100000 women
• 90%: of girls fully vaccinated with HPV vaccine by age 15
• 70%: women screened with high performance test by 35 years of age
• 90%: of women identified with cervical disease receive treatment

 13

Correct Answer (D)

Standardized death rates provide comparison in same Population

questions.text: SMR values which is indicative of a hazardous population is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

100
Explanation:
SMR/ standardized Mortality Ratios:
• Observed deaths per year/ Expected deaths per year  * 100
• Conclusion:
o SMR = 100: no increased death due to occupation
o SMR > 100: more death due to occupation
• Calculated in indirect standardization

questions.text: Incidence takes into account:

choices.text: Causal association best observed in RCT
Evidence is best observed in meta-analysis and systematic review
Temporality is best observed in cohort

questions.text: Which of the following statements is correct?

A researcher wants to do a study of blood level of lipids among people who smoke & those who don’t. But he is now concerned that the smokers might differ from non-smokers in their diet, exercise, etc. as well. This concern is known as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Selection Bias

Explanation:

Types of Bias

questions.text: A new estrogen receptor agonist is being evaluated for the treatment of postmenopausal symptoms. A prospective study shows that drug increases the risk of DVT in treated women who smoke compared to untreated women who smoke, with a RR of 1.7 & p value of 0.01. In non-smokers, no increased risk of DVT is evident with use of drug (RR = 0.96, p value = 0.06). Which of the following describes the phenomenon?
What is the RR of acquiring TB in households with a culture-positive case compared with households without TB?

choices.text: Can be used for rare outcome

questions.text: Which is not true for case control study?

A cohort of healthy individual at risk of developing a disease were chosen and followed over a period of 5-years period. During this time, 5 cases develop—1 case after 1 year, 1 after 2 years, 2 after 4 years, and 1 after 5 years. Each time a case or cases developed, same no. Of control was chosen from the same cohort. Identify the type of study:

Doctor 1 diagnoses cervical cancer using PAP smear and mean age of diagnosis is 40 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. Doctor 2 diagnoses cervical cancer using a new screening test (Y) and mean age of diagnosis is 35 years, gives available treatment and patients die at 60 years. As compared to the doctor 1; doctor 2 has provided patient:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

 Lead time bias
Explanation: 
• Lead Time Bias: occurs when the screening test advances the time of diagnosis, but no true prolongation of life occurs because survival for women who are screened & those who are not is the same from the time the cancer occurs

choices.text: Change in prevalence will reduce the predictive value of a negative result
Predictive value of a positive result will decline
Specificity of the test is likely to decline
Specificity will increase at expense of its sensitivity

questions.text: A diagnostic test has been in use for decades. However, with improvement in hygiene the prevalence of the disease falls from 35% to 5%. Which of the statements is correct?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B) 

Predictive value of a positive result will decline
Explanation: 
As the prevalence decreases:
• PPV will decrease (Option 2)
• NPV will increase (Option 1)
• Sensitivity & Specificity don’t change (Option 3 & 4)

choices.text: Absolute concentration of AFP in maternal serum
Family history of dizygotic twin pregnancy
Prevalence of NTD defects in the population in the question

questions.text: A blood test reveals that a 35-year-old woman at 18 weeks gestation has increased serum alpha fetoprotein. Of the following measures, which has the greatest influence in determining the predictive value of this test for NTD in foetus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Prevalence of NTD defects in the population in the question
Explanation: 
Predictive value depends on:
• Prevalence (maximum)
• Sensitivity and specificity

choices.text: Specificity of test is lower in population A
Prevalence of disease is lower in population A
Prevalence of disease is higher in population A
Specificity of the test is higher in population A

questions.text: A screening test is used in same way in 2 similar populations, but the proportion of false positive results among those who test positive in population A is lower than among those who test positive in population B. What is the likely explanation for this finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

 Prevalence of disease is higher in population A
Explanation: 
More false positives mean’s less prevalence.

choices.text: Net sensitivity is decreased & net specificity is increased
Net sensitivity is increased & net specificity is increased
Net sensitivity remain the same & net specificity is increased

questions.text: If hemoccult test is negative for screening of colonic cancer, no further test is done. If hemoccult test is positive individual will have a 2nd stool sample tested with hemoccult 2 test. If this 2nd test is positive for blood then individual will be referred for more extensive evaluation. Effect of net sensitivity & net specificity of this method of screening is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Net sensitivity is decreased & net specificity is increased  
Explanation: 
In case of test in series sensitivity decreases and specificity increases and vice versa in parallel. This question is test in series

questions.text: If the Sensitivity is 90% and specificity is 90% then the positive likelihood ratio is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)
9
Explanation: 
Positive Likelihood ratio = Sensitivity/ (1 -Specificity) = 0.9/ (1 – 0.9) = 0.9/ 0.1 = 9
Negative Likelihood ratio = (1- Sensitivity)/ Specificity
